item.title: Twitter
item.description: Twitter is an online social networking and microblogging service that enables users to send and read "tweets", which are text messages limited to 140 characters.

item.title: Facebook
item.description: Facebook is an online social networking service. Its name comes from a colloquialism for the directory given to students at some American universities.

item.title: Google+
item.description: Google has described Google+ as a "social layer" that enhances many of its online properties, and that it is not simply a social networking website, but also an authorship tool that associates web-content directly with its owner/author.

item.title: YouTube
item.description: YouTube is a video-sharing website, created by three former PayPal employees in February 2005 and owned by Google since late 2006, on which users can upload, view and share videos.
